title: 7-year-old NC girl killed, grandmother injured after shots fired into home
content:
SALISBURY, N.C. (WBTV) — A shooting in Salisbury left a 7-year-old girl dead and her grandmother wounded early Sunday morning.
Salisbury police arrived on scene just before 4:30 a.m. in the 200 block of Harrel Street.
A’yanna Allan, 7, was pronounce dead at the scene. Her grandmother, 56-year-old Shirley Robinson, was found with a gunshot wound to the leg. Robinson was taken to the hospital to be treated and has since been released from the hospital.
Sunday afternoon, Robinson told WBTV she and A’yanna were sleeping on the same bed when bullets were fired through their bedroom window.
The shooting is under investigation. Anyone with information regarding this case is encouraged to call the Salisbury Police Department at 704-638-5333 or Crime Stoppers at 1-866-639-5245.
